If you want to learn to strip tease I would defiantly recomend buying this, but if you want a work out try something more along the lines of Jennifer Galardi's 10 min solutions dance work out.

reviewText: There was no question that I was so excited to get this set. The question is is it worth it? Uh... it really depends on what you want. For me, no.  If you're wanting to work out to try to get toned, #2 is great. I felt this all day and the next. There are a lot of isometrics. I would recommend this singular video hands down. The rest of them... eh. They were ok. I have been using Turbo Jam for my aerobics, and I was looking for a set of dvds with the same uptempo workout to substitute for the days I want a change. There is no comparison. I found the strip routines as a whole, short and boring. You may pick up a few moves to add to your repritoire, but that's about it.Now, the videos might suck, but Carmen is a good teacher and motivator. She's not overly sexual, so it's not uncomfortable watching her and learning the moves. I gave this set 3 stars simply for video #2. If I could, I would go back and just buy that one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a great dvd. I got it for Xmas, and am totally impressed with this product. Carmen and her producers have put together a smart, well-crafted, fun workout. She has a great warmup, and you can do it with her instructions, or you can just follow along. There are two more routines, each with the option of having Carmen walk you through it, or you can just go along with the music. The music is customized, too, where you can choose to dance/workout to techno, hip-hop or rock. So it's been well thought out to offer variety. Carmen explains the moves well, gives you a chance to try them a couple of times with her, and then you work through the routine. The third routine is the most complex, with leads into floor work, and definitely takes more strength to do, so some may need to build to it, but she even tells you how to get down on the the floor and back up to standing without looking like a dork. The whole premise could be totally sleazy or totally corny, but it's handled well. Carmen tells you to loosen up a bit and enjoy the dancing and being sexy, but she approaches it with a sense of humor, like she knows some people are going to feel a  little goofy when instructed to smack their butt or whatever. But the moves are good, some are a bit reminiscent of bellydance (undulations, punching hips side to side, but with more attitude). But it's fun, very well done,  and I like all the options she offers, including in her intro telling you what her other dvds focus on (role playing, etc). It's fun and sassy, and you're working your whole body and it you're not staring at the clock waiting for it to end already. A great buy. More videos should be this well thought out and this fun to do. And yeah, guys won't mind watching this either.
Title: N/A

reviewText: DVD 1 says Aerobic Strip Tease but it is really anything but. It is more like strip tease basics. I bought this to get a great workout but also have fun doing it. Fun it may be but no where near a good workout. It is basically a few simple dances and a little warm-up.If you are new to fitness then this may be a enough to raise that heart rate a tad and get you use to moving. Also if you are looking for a way to spice up your marriage a little and decide to do a little saucy novice strip tease for the husband then this would be helpful but other than that I find this trivial.So to sum it up-Wanna learn how to get off your knees in a sexy way? Then here you go. If you are looking for a a heart pumping dance workout, look elsewhere because this is not it!As for DVD 2 (Fit to Strip) I like it a lot better. It is a decent strength training workout that requires nothing more than a chair and a yoga mat. This one has nothing to do with stripping or dancing. It is just toning and strength training. It is a total body routine but customizable. You can choose if you just want to do arms, legs or abs. Michael Carson is wonderful at explaining and demonstrating the moves in a friendly and simply way. Carmen really don't have much to do with this one other than acting like a cast and putting in little tid bits of dialogue. I recommend this to anyone that is trying to lose weight. It may not be aerobic but it will help prevent that flab from dropping the weight and make you feel stronger so it is easier to get through all that cardio from other workouts.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The title of this DVD makes it sound like it's something really advanced (and aerobic).  But actually the first two DVDs in Carmen's set are much more physically challenging than this one.  This DVD is kind of a cheesy joke.  It consists of two 10 minute strip routines which require dressing up.  The first one is a "sexy librarian."  To do the routine as Carmen demonstrates you need some glasses and a scarf.  The next routine is wearing men's clothing--a big button shirt, a tie, and a really stupid hat.  Taking these items off is an integral part of the routine, although there is no actual nudity involved.The routines are too slow and short to actually count as aerobic.  So this DVD is useful for one thing...learning some strip routines to act out for your significant other.  Although I think I could make some up that wouldn't seem as embarassingly silly as parts of this DVD.I was looking for a fun dance routine that would get my heart pumping but this is definately not it!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I received this DVD as a gag gift for Christmas one year.  I recently became bored with my normal workout DVD's and decided to give it a go.I think Carmen was stretching things a bit when she named this DVD AEROBIC Striptease.There are two short 'routines'.  In the first one you dress like a librarian. Carmen has on stilettos, business suit, scarf, glasses and her hair is up.  She takes you through a small dance where you lose the glasses, scarf and the hair comes down.  It was a little too brief for me and a little dull.The second one was a lap dance.  This one was a little more fun.  The idea is to be dressed in your lovers dress shirt, tie and hat along with your stilettos.  The routine takes you through a small lap dance involving a chair.  Your supposed to do everything like someone is sitting there.  You do a little dance in front of the chair, and remove the tie.  A little bump and grind on the lap of your imaginary partner and you remove the shirt.I have to admit I got a kick out of working out in the stilettos.  It was a little fun.  As far as a work out, I did both routines and barely elevated my heart beat.Rating the sexiness of these routines on a scale of 1-10, I would say the librarian gig would rate a 4 and the lap dance, maybe a 6. The stripper routines are 'cute' and a little sexy.  You'll have to add a little more spice if you're looking to heat things up at home.The music in the DVD was better than I thought it would be, but still not that great.  It had an OK beat, but that's all it had going for it.  I've heard many songs that sound to me like stripper music. This one song in the DVD, did not.If you're looking to lose weight, this is not the DVD for you.It's better than not doing any work out at all, and if you repeat the routines later that evening for a one-man audience, then I guess you'll burn a few more calories. ;)
summary: You can leave your hat on...

The exercises they are doing involve a lot of motion and exertion, and it makes for excellent viewing material. reviewText: Every summer, I have a plan to get in shape. I've probably done this for about 8 years now? Maybe. Some years, I'm more successful than others, of course. Usually, I've either walked or done Denise Austin's 7:00AM workout.This year, I'm trying something different.About a month ago, my mom (yes, my mom) bought me this DVD. I'd been joking about it, but was a little daunted by it. I mean, Carmen Elektra's a total babe, and I'm not terribly confident.Needless to say, I've been doing the first couple of routines for a few days, now. And, it's so much fun! Who knew, right? Carmen is very accessible - it's less like a celebrity, more like a good friend showing you how to have a little fun. The dances are cute, not slutty. There's nothing on this DVD that you couldn't playfully show your friends, and nothing that won't make you feel better in the bedroom. Of course, you may want to practice and watch yourself in a mirror to ensure that you're being sexy, and not... well... flailing. :)The routines are very simple, and are practiced piece by piece with and without instruction and music. There are also two other dancers that you can watch, instead of Carmen. And, what's fun about it, besides the dance is that, every time Carmen begins to take herself a little too seriously, she cracks up. :) It's really a great DVD, and I plan on collecting the entire set.Truthfully, though, it's not that great of a workout. If you really put yourself into it, you can work up a sweat. But, I think the point is that you're working up a sweat after the dance. ;)I highly recommend the DVD, and encourage you gals (and guys, why not) to try it! A strip tease DVD doesn't mean you have to do it for anyone, and it doesn't mean you're a slut. It means you're an open-minded woman having a little bit of fun. It makes you feel sexy, confident, and maybe like you've got a naughty little secret. Again, I just can't emphasize how much fun it is. :)
Title: N/A

reviewText: Maybe you aren't that interested in stripping, but ARE interested in a great work-out video with a professional.  Well, ladies, here it is.  I love Carmen Electra.  I bought them all, hoping to learn a few moves while getting some exercise.  Basically, the rest in the series are garbage.  They are not going to help get you in shape, and I didn't use any of them more than a couple of times.Disc 2, however, I have used for years.  Carmen does the whole thing with fitness trainer, Michael Carson.  He is very informative and the exercises are great for women looking to get in better shape without doing something ridiculously hard like P90X.  There is the basic overall aerobics, and then you can also do the scenes that are meant for certain parts of your body.  Doing all of it takes about 50 minutes.  If you can't find the energy to do it all at first, just start with the basic workout.The both of them really make a great team and are fun to watch.  Carmen is just a down-to-earth looking girl who is a little lost on what to do.  Michael will help correct her mistakes (ones I know that I definitely made at first), and Michael will show you ways to make exercises harder once you've mastered them.It's cute, fun, and I lost about 20 pounds in 3 months and got really fit.  I really owe it all to Carmen and Michael!  The only downsides to this DVD are sometimes the scenes are choppy (badly edited), and it is annoying to hear the same jokes over and over and over again.  So these days (since I know what they're saying word by word), I just mute it and blast some good workout music on my speakers.Great video for women who are really looking to get fit!
summary: The beneficial DVD of the series!

reviewText: Okay, so I haven't actually done the workout yet, but browsed through the chapters on my laptop, and I'm already skeptical.  I think Carmen Electra is great, and this is a cute dvd, so the only reason why I am giving it three stars is because it's supposed to be a WORKOUT dvd.  First of all, there are really only two striptease routines (the second one has a little floorwork), because the first one is the dancer's warmup (which is like 8-counts of neck stretching and stuff).  The last routine looked like it worked some muscles with the floorwork, though.  But overall, Carmen and her two accomplices weren't sweating at ALL (in their little short shorts and knee high socks), and I don't think I will either.  I'll say more when I get my "workout" on.  ***So I did the workout, and I must say I didn't sweat at all and felt like I would have toned my legs more by walking around the mall.  I mean, it's a cute little dancy thing to do, especially if you need to feel sexier, but you definitely won't lose weight or tone up by doing this.  The blonde girl in the back was really annoying too; she just looked too callgirlish for me.  Anyway, it was a nice try, but I'll stick to cardio.
summary: Cute routines, but too short with a low workout factor.

reviewText: The routines are easily broken down to teach you what you need to learn, it has a great warm up and then slowly shows you the steps. You can repeat the instruction part as many times as you like until you learn it, because that is its own chapter. If you are wanting more of a cardio workout then just repeat the routines more than once not only to get your heartbeat up but just to get it down better.I love this series, its fun, completely unique and different and just something great to throw into a usual routine.One other thing, Im 9 months pregnant and having a huge belly is a little challenging (to say the least) to do some of the midsection moves. But if I can do it then someone who doesnt have a watermellon for a belly should definatley be able to learn! When my baby is born look out! I cant wait to be able to control that section better.Its awesome, seriously one of the best workout series Ive come across in a long time. Pregnant or not.

reviewText: I am reviewing Fit to Strip only.  Amazon is lumping all of the reviews together.  This DVD is a fun, low-impact 30-50 minute workout that you can do all at once or in two parts.  I am a short gal and tend to look bulky if I lift heavier weights or focus on certain types of exercise.  This DVD helps me get leaner thighs and a lifted bottom.  The instructor is easy to follow and Carmen is very down-to-earth.  If you want a toned, lean build this is a nice addition to any fitness collection.  Only a mat and chair are needed.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I really like doing this workout.  Trust me, I am not the kind of person that enjoys exercising but I actually look forward to doing this DVD and I always feel great afterwards.  Yoga and pilates have never been "fast" enough for me, when I am working out I like to be sweating and breathing hard, but the moves in this video give me some of the same feelings that I really like about them.  I feel like I am really lengthening and toning my muscles instead of just really building up one particular muscle.  The guy that is in it is really fun and makes everything really clear, and Carmen is great.  I am not exactly coordinated ;) and I have an easy time following this video.  I love that the encouragement and comments are more geared towards feeling more confident, and being comfortable with your body as opposed to just burning calories or fat like some of the other videos.  Also, I like that Carmen has a softer more curvaceous body.  As ridiculous as that may sound I hate when I watch an exercise video and I would hate to have my body look like the instructors.  It makes me sort of feel like "If that is what my body is going to look like if I stick with this video, no thanks"  However, if my body ended up being as fabulous as Carmen's I wouldn't complain.  It is a great video for working your entire body, and it is SO hard!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you're looking to learn how to do a striptease, this volume is not the one you want (get volume 1).  But if you're looking to tone up your body, then this is the DVD for you.  I like that there are so many different programs to choose from--it prevents boredom, and you can target certain areas or combine your favorite workouts together.  Also, you don't need any equipment except a chair to do all the routines.  If you're already in great shape, it probably won't do too much except help maintain your fitness level, but if you're trying to get back into exercising regularly, this is a great segueway.  Additionally, the instructor and Carmen are very low-key and unannoying compared to most workout programs where you are assaulted by "upbeat", overly cheerful exhortations.
summary: A good workout... but it doesn't involve stripping
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this DVD on sale on a whim and I'm glad I did!  The moves are really fun and perfect for a beginner.  Think of this as a "teaser" DVD, to help get you into the series- it's not intimidating or overwhelming.  I'm sure this dvd would be horribly basic for a pro exotic dancer, but ultimately a normal girl buys this dvd to impress their S.O. and feel sexy.  Keeping that in mind, this is not a fitness dvd that will help you lose weight.  There are plenty on the market for that purpose.  Reserve this one for when exercise is getting boring for you or you want to learn some sexy moves for your next anniversary/valentine's day/rendezvous.  There are only two routines on this disc, which is disappointing, but remember it's a "teaser." Give it a go and actually practice the moves to perfection and you will be challenged.  Heck, I'm a bellydancer and it took me a while!  I plan on buying the whole series. :)

reviewText: I want to start off by saying I have no desire to ever strip, either on stage or at home for my boyfriend. I just am not that type of girl - I'd probably fall on the floor laughing first. So I have utterly no interest in any of Carmen's DVD series... except for this one. Fit to Strip is an all-workout DVD - no stripping instruction whatsoever - and it's actually pretty good! I write about fitness for a living so I do a lot of exercise DVDs, and this one did the trick for me, as far as full body workouts go. It fatigued my muscles and I was even sore the next day. And it was a safe workout too (in other words, you probably won't hurt yourself doing this DVD - I've seen some that are downright dangerous). I must credit the instructor, Michael Carson, for all this - he's the pro trainer who gets Carmen Electra (and you) moving. He knows his stuff. And this DVD doesn't require any equipment, except maybe a mat, which is another plus. So even if you don't want to "take it ALL off" for an audience, doing this workout will help you look good in your tightest jeans and skimpiest top - which is good enough for me.
summary: Good Workout Even for Non-Stripper Wannabes

reviewText: I had a lot of fun doing this workout.  It was nice to break up by regular routine at the gym; from even the various classes I usually take there. The convenience of doing this from home on my time instead of a gym schedule is really atttractive. I've been working out for about 10 years now in all manners available, and this workout, while not challenging in terms of intricate moves, gave me a thorough, sweaty workout.  My legs, arms and core burn, the former more intensely than the latter.Carmen Electra is not as annoying as I'd initally thought. Her companion, the fitness instructor, has a low intimidation factor, explaining/demonstrating maneuvers well. Will definitely be using this in between going to the gym.
summary: Fun departure from the regular gym workout

reviewText: I definitely felt the burn in only a few reps with these targeted moves.  This is a video that will keep challenging you, and let me tell you, the body parts that I worked (particularly thighs and butt) were sore for a couple of days afterward.  Carmen and the trainer are fun workout partners, not annoying or patronizing like some fitness video trainers.  I highly recommend this dvd for some in-home toning fun. reviewText: One wouldn't reccomend Camren Electra to do a workout series, but a striptease series? Why not! The first DVD in the series is fun and effective. I have been exercizing for 10yrs now on a daily basis, and truth be told, things that I haven't worked in a while are being worked. My usual routine consist of: Tae bo, waits, DDR, running, and resistance training. However, I was missing something in my regular workout routine that this DVD filled.I've only done the first two DVD's so far, and I can definitely vouch for both of them being extremely exffective, as my body toned up and trimmed down within the first three days I used the DVD's. My arms are slimmer, my abs tighter, my thighs trimmer, and my butt firmer. I'm also gaining flexibility back in when I thought I'd never get it back.If I had to say something negative about this DVD, it would probably be that Carmen as an instructer is encouraging, but not all that informative. She seems slightly, well, empty-headed. Other than that though, I really have no complaints, the routines are fun, cute, and easy to learn. At the same time, they really do firm you up. I would reccomend them to anyone whom wants to spice up their regular workout regime, or to anyone who hates exercise.Have fun & God Bless ~Amy

It's like having a personal trainer without the use of weights, incorporating unique ways to use various muscles.  Carmen is just a participant right along with the viewer. reviewText: Overall, this DVD is fantastic for beginner to intermediate. (If you are already very toned, then this might be too easy for you.) It's a good mix of legs, abs, upper body, and rear end, with a little bit of cardio. I get the best results from the exercises for the rear and thighs. I'm working on making the abs section more difficult for myself because I don't usually feel sore in the midsection the next day. I supplement this with other cardio routines because there are only about 5-6 minutes of cardio at the beginning. The arms portion could be more difficult, but I sometimes add my own weights to get better results. I'm very happy with Michael's explanations of the exercises, and all of the moves are very safe. I usually do all five sections (about 55 minutes total) for a good full body toning workout.

reviewText: If you're hoping to get in shape for your swimsuit--or for your lingerie--this dvd could be an integral part of your workout routine. I recommend doing the workout in this dvd (takes about 55 minutes if you do them all) five days a week and then do the weight training routines from QuickFix TotalMix.  There are a few reasons why.First of all, you just have to do cardio to lose weight.  The Carmen Electra dvd does a good bit of cardio, but I recommend pausing the dvd after the ballerina squats to do one more set of each, and then pausing again with the squat/leg lift combo to do another rep just so you get enough cardio.  You've got to get your heart rate up!  If you do this five days a week, combined with the weight training, you should lose about a pound a week (without even changing your diet...Of course, if you do change your diet you may shed pounds faster).For the weight training, do those three times a week.  Lifting weights rules because muscle mass burns calories more efficiently.  Honestly, you just sit, or sleep, and those muscles use up the caloric energy.  It's just not fair!  Fat sits there and jiggles but muscles work even when you don't.  It's like a self-perpetuating thing.Anyways.  I had fun with the striptease workout, even if the title was far more provocative than the exercises.  There are some new exercises to try, which is great.It's a fun way to work out and a great way to start to lose weight and firm up your naked body!
summary: Nice change-up to the old exercise routine
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just used the "Fit to Strip" video for the first time yesterday and loved it!  It's a very intense workout, yet it's extremely easy to follow.  The trainer does go fast, but I did not have any trouble understanding his instructions and kept up pretty well.The nice thing is that a trainer is doing the instruction and Carmen is more of the student.  So she'll ask questions and he'll correct poses and what not along the way.  It almost felt like working out with another newbie and made it less intimidating.  Although she's got a great body, it was nice to see that Carmen seemed to be struggling at the same parts the rest of us would.The DVD includes a LOT of different workout options so you can customize what you want to work on based on the areas you want to target, the time you have to workout and what mood you're in.The routine is strenuous yet includes enough stretching that you do not feel overly sore, just a slight burn the next day.I highly recommend this workout DVD and good luck!
summary: Easy to follow, yet a heck of a workout!

reviewText: Item arrived as expected with NO scratches, tears, problems, or hassles. Great DVD plus there's a WONDERFUL warm-up you can do with ANY activity; I still use it a couple times a day. Great transaction. Thank you.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I rented this DVD to try what I thought would be a fun, aerobic workout, but I was very disappointed.  The "workout" consisted of 3 mini routines.  The first routine is the longest, slowest warm-up I have ever done on a DVD.  The second & third routine are mini dance routines.  Carmen was a good teacher as far as the dance steps went.  She took the routine slowly and kept repeating moves and trying everything you learned to music so I felt that the steps were easy to follow and that the routines were easy to remember, which was nice.  The steps were not hard or complicated so it is a good beginners DVD.  However, I did not like the DVD because I felt that my heart rate only went up a little and I never got even close to breaking a sweat.  The other thing that I did not like was the filming of the workout.  Carmen teaches you the moves and then you do the whole routine to music with no talking/instruction.  The camera kept zooming in on Carmen's face or slowly panning down her body and you need to see what her body is doing so you can follow her, but you couldn't.  I had high hopes for this DVD, but felt that it was a very ineffective workout.  If you want something to do for fun and want to learn a few stripper moves then you can try this DVD, otherwise, don't bother.
Title: N/A

reviewText: To be honest, I'm going to give this a second try after I work out elsewhere first. However, as it now sits on my DVD shelf, I'll give it a partial review:Pros:1) I realized that even though I feel ridiculous, it can actually look ok.2) I've loosened up and enjoyed dancing for my boyfriend.Cons:1) I popped my neck wrong following her stretches. The other exercise program I use now says that stretching your neck back strains it. Great to know now.2) I wasn't flexible enough for the intro routine, so it was hard for me to understand how to do what she was showing. I gave up after the third thing that I didn't understand and she didn't explain.

reviewText: This is just a bit of fun really.she giggles too much, there is no cool down, and the explanations for some of the moves are severely lacking, but when you run the warm up and 2 routines together you get a mildly cardio 15 minute routine. personally I liked the floorwork in the third routine.don't get this thinking it is sexy. It isn't. It just isn't. I use it as a warm up DVD before I do something else.

reviewerName: TASMANIAN MINIMALIST "Please read my blog Tas...
reviewText: Maybe I am getting old or someting, but I loved it. It didn't make me feel too tired and it DID make me feel feminine. I get so bored with fitness routines, but this was so cute and so easy. I like that she broke the routines down slowly, and maybe it isn't going to make you super fit on it's own, but it is a good workout to do when you don't feel like working too hard. The girls are all very healthy looking and inspirational. I will buy some of the others and I will show off the skills to my darling man. He'll love the outcome.
summary: I loved it....anything that makes me feel girly !!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: The title of this DVD doesn't lie. You learn strippers' moves, which happens to provide a good workout in the process. And like Carmen says, if you're doing it right, then it's hard work. If you play the DVD in its entirety, you'll be working out for about 55 minutes. And even if you just play one of the programmed selections that run through each segment quickly, you'll still get a compact workout (about 15 minutes) that warms you up & gets your body moving. One of the great features of the DVD is that all 3 routines are broken down, depending on time restraints and/or personal preference (with instruction vs. performing the routines straight through just to music). The 1st routine is more like a proper warm up for the 2nd two. And you're definitely working out your body: your stretching, your working your core when doing moves like body rolls, and your working your legs, hips, & butt. Overall, it's just a really fun way to exercise. And I'm all for women being in touch with their sexuality.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this several months ago & only did it 2x.The menu options are great, there are many chapters to choose from & you can either choose with or without instruction. You can also choose between three different kinds of music throughout the workout: rock, house & hip/hop.What I hate most is when she is teaching nice & slow with a lot of talking, there is only soft almost elevator-like music to keep you inspiried & makes it feel more slow. The whole workout, she teaches first with alot of talking with soft, boring music at half speed 2-3x, then normal speed 2-3x more. THEN there's good music & you following along normal tempo with NO talking at all & that's repeated several times. Each time you learn new moves when the music comes on, you do all the previous moves as well, building to a routine. There are two very short routines.The warm-up itself is great & long & extensive. The pace is slow w/o music, but great for building endurance for anyone who isn't in althletic shape. You'll definitely feel stretched out & already muscle use. She talks a lot about theory as well as warning about injury from moving incorrectly & describing how to move including analogies. Then it's repeated with music & no instruction at all, just mimic by watching & memory of what you were taught.The workout she teaches a few moves at a time, teaching in the usual 8-count dancer style with very good cues & instruction, almost perfect. Almost everyone should have no trouble understanding/following the moves. The movies themselves get me.... It's actually very fast, almost the same style you'd see on any music video or music commercial with a few butt slaps, a finger in the mouth & on your back with legs crossing added in. There's only a few mooves on the floor.You definitely will get a decent toning workout especially by doing the moves & make it seem like you're graceful & light as a father though holding all your weight as you dip in a squat many times or on your back holding your weight on your arms, etc. Becasue of the pace being slow, fast, slow, fast... not as much as a cardio workout unless once you master you just do it w/o instruction normal speed for the whole workout or even repeat it.One I like as well is Jeff Costa's Cardio Strip Tease.
summary: Fun/good teaching, decent workout, slow pace & short content
